title: How to Make Vegetarian Risotto

steps.headline: Make your basic risotto recipe.
steps.description: Put your saucepan on low heat and melt 1T of butter or 1T oil. When warm enough to sauté, add the chopped onion, garlic & rice. Stir very well but don't allow to brown. Keep the heat low if needs be.

steps.headline: When the rice is opaque, add 1 cup of stock and stir well.
steps.description: Keep stirring until it is absorbed which could be 2 or 3 minutes. If you have hard vegetables to add such as pumpkin, add them at this stage.

steps.headline: When this is absorbed, add the next cup of stock.
steps.description: Continue to stir and add firm vegetables if you picked the capsicum or zucchini  recipes.

steps.headline: Keep stirring and add the next cup.
steps.description: At this stage the goal is the vegetables should be 1/3rd cooked. You can add asparagus at this stage as it doesn't take as long to cook.

steps.headline: Allow to simmer gently.
steps.description: Add the next cup when it is absorbed continue to stir, but aim not to mash or stir furiously, it's a gentle stir. Put on some music if this helps.

steps.headline: Add the final cup of wine or stock and add your seasonings and/or grated cheese.
steps.description: If you picked the fried mushrooms or frozen peas option add them now with seasonings together.

steps.headline: Allow this cup to absorb then taste the rice & veges to see if its cooked through.
steps.description: If it needs a little longer, turn off the heat and put the lid on for 5 minutes. The consistency should be distinct rice grains & vegetables in a creamy sauce. It shouldn't ideally be soupy, or stiff like mashed potato but in between.

steps.headline: Stir before serving and add salt & pepper to taste, or a little cream if desired for extra creaminess.
steps.description: Serve with extra grated cheese if you wish.

text: Make your basic risotto recipe. Put your saucepan on low heat and melt 1T of butter or 1T oil. When warm enough to sauté, add the chopped onion, garlic & rice. Stir very well but don't allow to brown. Keep the heat low if needs be. When the rice is opaque, add 1 cup of stock and stir well. Keep stirring until it is absorbed which could be 2 or 3 minutes. If you have hard vegetables to add such as pumpkin, add them at this stage. When this is absorbed, add the next cup of stock. Continue to stir and add firm vegetables if you picked the capsicum or zucchini  recipes. Keep stirring and add the next cup. At this stage the goal is the vegetables should be 1/3rd cooked. You can add asparagus at this stage as it doesn't take as long to cook. Allow to simmer gently. Add the next cup when it is absorbed continue to stir, but aim not to mash or stir furiously, it's a gentle stir. Put on some music if this helps. Add the final cup of wine or stock and add your seasonings and/or grated cheese. If you picked the fried mushrooms or frozen peas option add them now with seasonings together. Allow this cup to absorb then taste the rice & veges to see if its cooked through. If it needs a little longer, turn off the heat and put the lid on for 5 minutes. The consistency should be distinct rice grains & vegetables in a creamy sauce. It shouldn't ideally be soupy, or stiff like mashed potato but in between. Stir before serving and add salt & pepper to taste, or a little cream if desired for extra creaminess. Serve with extra grated cheese if you wish. Finished.
